TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RingtoneManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: RingtoneManager provides access to ringtones, notification, and other types of sounds.

remarks.para: RingtoneManager provides access to ringtones, notification, and other types of sounds. It manages querying the different media providers and combines the results into a single cursor. It also provides a for each ringtone. We generically call these sounds ringtones, however the refers to the type of sounds that are suitable for the phone ringer.
To show a ringtone picker to the user, use the intent to launch the picker as a subactivity.

remarks.para: Constructs a RingtoneManager. The instance constructed by this constructor will not manage the cursor(s), so the client should handle this itself.

Docs.summary: Returns a of all the ringtones available.

remarks.para: Returns a of all the ringtones available. The returned cursor will be the same cursor returned each time this method is called, so do not the cursor. The cursor can be safely.
If was not used, the caller should manage the returned cursor through its activity's life cycle to prevent leaking the cursor.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a .

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a . The of the ringtone to play when the user attempts to preview the "Default" ringtone. This can be one of , , or to have the "Default" point to the current sound for the given default sound type. If you are showing a ringtone picker for some other type of sound, you are free to provide any here.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a .

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a . The of the current ringtone, which will be used to show a checkmark next to the item for this . If showing an item for "Default" (@see ), this can also be one of , , or to have the "Default" item checked.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean.

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean. Whether to include DRM ringtones.

Docs.summary: Returned from the ringtone picker as a .

remarks.para: Returned from the ringtone picker as a .

It will be one of:
the picked ringtone,
a that equals , , or if the default was chosen,
null if the "Silent" item was picked.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean.

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean. Whether to show an item for "Default".

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean.

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a boolean. Whether to show an item for "Silent". If the "Silent" item is picked, will be null.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as a .

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as a . The title to show for the ringtone picker. This has a default value that is suitable in most cases.

Docs.summary: Given to the ringtone picker as an int.

remarks.para: Given to the ringtone picker as an int. Specifies which ringtone type(s) should be shown in the picker. One or more of , , , or (bitwise-ored together).

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Whether retrieving another will stop playing the previously retrieved .
If this is false, make sure to any previous ringtones to free resources.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
